required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-invasive Measurement of Neonatal Central and Peripheral Hemodynamics
clinical_study.official_title: Non-invasive Measurement of Neonatal Central and Peripheral Hemodynamics, as Valuable Diagnostic and Treatment Efficiency Criterium of Neonatal Sepsis

brief_summary.textblock: Non-invasively neonatal cardiac output can be measured by multiple methods, but the gold standard still remains conventional echocardiography. It is accurate, but needs a long training for new users to assess cardiac function. Continuous-wave Doppler ultrasound monitor USCOM is a relatively new monitor which can perform faster and less complex cardiac function measurement, also it is easier for the operator to get trained. The aim of the study is to assess the level of agreement between cardiac output measured with conventional echocardiography and with USCOM, to present normal ranges for neonates of different gestational age and to look for early signs of hemodynamic changes during sepsis.

primary_outcome.description: Chest and head circumference in centimeters
non- invasive arterial blood pressure measurement in mmHg
pulse rate in beats per minute

primary_outcome.measure: Near- Infrared Spectroscopy for regional blood flow
primary_outcome.description: One sensor on the forehead, another- on the back to check for regional blood flow in the brain and kidney with Near- Infrared Spectroscopy

primary_outcome.measure: Echocardioscopy for left ventricular outflow tract diameter
primary_outcome.description: Echocardiography for left ventricular outflow tract diameter in centimeters

primary_outcome.measure: Echocardioscopy to measure velocity time integral
primary_outcome.description: Echocardiography to measure velocity time integral at the aortic valve in centimeters. After that the software of the device calculates cardiac output.

USCOM 1A uses continuous wave Doppler for flow curves, which are obtained at the suprasternal notch for an optimal flow signal at the aortic valve. The software of the device calculates cardiac output then

arm_group.description: Neonate 26 weeks to 36 weeks + 6 days of gestation, without congenital heart defects and/or hemodynamically significant fetal circulation, any respiratory therapy, nor need of supplemental oxygen. Subjects had no clinically and laboratory-identified infections.

Neonate from 37 weeks of gestation, without congenital heart defects and/or hemodynamically significant fetal circulation, any respiratory therapy, nor need of supplemental oxygen. Subjects had no clinically and laboratory-identified infections.
Neonate of any gestation, without congenital heart defects, with clinically and laboratory-identified infection.

intervention.description: doplerometry with USCOM and echocardiograph is made for assessing central blood flow and spectroscopy with NONIN- for the blood flow in individual peripheral organs (brain and kidney)
intervention.other_name: GE LOGIQ S8 XDclear 2.0 ultrasound system with S4-10-D (3-9MHz) probe

study_pop.textblock: The study enrolled both preterm and full-term newborns of any gestational age, without congenital heart defects and/or hemodynamically significant fetal circulation, any respiratory therapy, nor need of supplemental oxygen. Subjects had no clinically and laboratory-identified infections in control group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- newborns of any gestational age
- parental consent acquired
Exclusion Criteria:
- congenital malformations
- hemodynamic instability in control group
- any respiratory support in control group
- infection in control group
